thread.title: Despite NFL career, Jameis Winston continues to pursue degree at FSU | Bucs Wire
thread.title_full: Despite NFL career, Jameis Winston continues to pursue degree at FSU | Bucs Wire

author: Bonnie Mott
title: Despite NFL career, Jameis Winston continues to pursue degree at FSU | Bucs Wire
text:
Despite NFL career, Jameis Winston continues to pursue degree at FSU Despite NFL career, Jameis Winston continues to pursue degree at FSU By Bonnie Mott 7 minutes ago shares By: Bonnie Mott | 7 minutes ago 
During Jameis Winston’s visit to Melrose Elementary in St. Petersburg on Wednesday, he confirmed that he is still in the midst of taking online classes at Florida State University as he continues to work on pursuing his degree. 
Winston said that he is taking classes online this spring and will take classes in the summer as well, prior to the beginning of the 2017 NFL season. He told students at the school that he is 26 credit hours away from his degree, but is motivated and determined to earn it. Especially since it is a goal his mother has always wanted him to accomplish. “I’m taking classes right now. I’m focusing on graduating college. That’s a big accomplishment,” Winston said “I’ve got to get my mama that degree. How many of you are going to get your mama that degree?” 
Winston left college early to pursue his NFL career and has seen a significant amount of success in his first two seasons under center. Instead of being a senior in college this year, the 23-year-old just finished wrapping up a 2016 campaign that resulted in him becoming the first quarterback in NFL history to throw for over 4,000 yards in their first two seasons. He also helped lead the Bucs to a 9-7 record in their first winning season since 2010. However, although Winston has seen a good amount of success on the gridiron, he has made it clear that earning his degree is a priority and something he plans to accomplish very soon.
